025
026package org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.taglets;
027
028import java.util.EnumSet;
029import java.util.IllegalFormatException;
030import java.util.Optional;
031import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
032import javax.lang.model.element.VariableElement;
033
034import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.BaseConfiguration;
035import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.Content;
036import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.Messages;
037import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.CommentHelper;
038import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.Utils;
039
040import com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree;
041import com.sun.source.doctree.TextTree;
042import com.sun.source.doctree.ValueTree;
043import jdk.javadoc.doclet.Taglet.Location;
044
045/**
046 * An inline taglet representing the value tag. This tag should only be used with
047 * constant fields that have a value.  It is used to access the value of constant
048 * fields.  This inline tag has an optional field name parameter.  If the name is
049 * specified, the constant value is retrieved from the specified field.  A link
050 * is also created to the specified field.  If a name is not specified, the value
051 * is retrieved for the field that the inline tag appears on.  The name is specified
052 * in the following format:  [fully qualified class name]#[constant field name].
053 */
054public class ValueTaglet extends BaseTaglet {
055
056    /**
057     * Construct a new ValueTaglet.
058     */
059    public ValueTaglet() {
060        super(DocTree.Kind.VALUE, true, EnumSet.allOf(Location.class));
061    }
062
063    /**
064     * Returns the referenced field or a null if the value tag
065     * is empty or the reference is invalid.
066     *
067     * @param holder the tag holder.
068     * @param config the  configuration of the doclet.
069     * @param tag the value tag.
070     *
071     * @return the referenced field or null.
072     */
073    private VariableElement getVariableElement(Element holder,
074            BaseConfiguration config, DocTree tag) {
075        CommentHelper ch = config.utils.getCommentHelper(holder);
076        String signature = ch.getReferencedSignature(tag);
077
078        Element e = signature == null
079            ? holder
080            : ch.getReferencedMember(tag);
081
082        return (e != null && config.utils.isVariableElement(e))
083            ? (VariableElement) e
084            : null;
085    }
086
087    @Override
088    public Content getInlineTagOutput(Element holder, DocTree tag,
089            TagletWriter writer) {
090        BaseConfiguration configuration = writer.configuration();
091        Utils utils = configuration.utils;
092        Messages messages = configuration.getMessages();
093        VariableElement field = getVariableElement(holder, configuration, tag);
094        if (field == null) {
095            if (tag.toString().isEmpty()) {
096                // Invalid use of @value
097                messages.warning(holder,
098                    "doclet.value_tag_invalid_use");
099            } else {
100                // Reference is unknown.
101                messages.warning(holder,
102                    "doclet.value_tag_invalid_reference", tag.toString());
103            }
104        } else if (field.getConstantValue() != null) {
105            TextTree format = ((ValueTree) tag).getFormat();
106            String text;
107            if (format != null) {
108                String f = format.getBody();
109                if (f.startsWith("\"")) {
110                    f = f.substring(1, f.length() - 1);
111                }
112                try {
113                    text = String.format(configuration.getLocale(), f,
114                        field.getConstantValue());
115                } catch (IllegalFormatException e) {
116                    messages.error(holder,
117                        "doclet.value_tag_invalid_format", format);
118                    return writer.invalidTagOutput(
119                        messages.getResources()
120                            .getText("doclet.value_tag_invalid_format", format),
121                        Optional.empty());
122                }
123            } else {
124                text = utils.constantValueExpression(field);
125            }
126            return writer.valueTagOutput(field,
127                text,
128                !field.equals(holder));
129        } else {
130            // Referenced field is not a constant.
131            messages.warning(holder,
132                "doclet.value_tag_invalid_constant",
133                utils.getSimpleName(field));
134        }
135        return writer.getOutputInstance();
136    }
137}
